qas.question: Beyonce's fourth album debuted in what year?
Which single had the most success from that album?
Beyonce won an award for which activity in 2011?
in 2011, Beyonce performed for four nights where?
When was Beyonce's forth album released?
How many copies did the album sell in its first week?
Who awarded Beyonce and award for writing?

answers.text: New York Association of Black Journalists

qas.question: When did she perform at the Roseland ballroom?
What is the name of Beyoncé's fourth studio album?
How many copies of 4 sold in the first week?
What magazine did Beyoncé write a story for about her earlier hiatus?
Where did Beyoncé perform for four nights of standing room only concerts in 2011?

context: Her fourth studio album <a8_0>4<a8_0/> was released on <a4_0><a9_0>June 28, <a0_0><a7_0>2011<a9_0/><a7_0/><a4_0/><a0_0/> in the US. 4 sold <a5_0><a10_0>310,000<a10_0/> copies<a5_0/> in its first week and debuted atop the Billboard 200 chart, giving Beyoncé her fourth consecutive number-one album in the US. The album was preceded by two of its singles "Run the World (Girls)" and "Best Thing I Never Had", which both attained moderate success. The fourth single "<a1_0>Love on Top<a1_0/>" was a commercial success in the US. 4 also produced four other singles; "Party", "Countdown", "I Care" and "End of Time". "Eat, Play, Love", a cover story written by Beyoncé for <a11_0>Essence<a11_0/> that detailed her 2010 career break, won her a <a2_0>writing<a2_0/> award from the <a6_0>New York Association of Black Journalists<a6_0/>. In late 2011, she took the stage at <a3_0><a12_0>New York's Roseland Ballroom<a12_0/><a3_0/> for four nights of special performances: the 4 Intimate Nights with Beyoncé concerts saw the performance of her 4 album to a standing room only.
